Position: Jr Officer – Internal Audit and Compliance

Location: Kathmandu

Laxmi Group is a prominent business conglomerate in Nepal with a diverse portfolio across various industries, including automotive. The automotive division of Laxmi Group represents leading global brands such as Hyundai, BMW, SML Isuzu, Total Energies, and Tata Green Batteries. With a strong commitment to excellence, the company focuses on delivering high-quality products and services that meet customer needs and expectations. Laxmi Group is widely recognized for its contribution to Nepal’s automotive market and its dedication to fostering innovation and growth.

Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Jr Officer – Internal Audit and Compliance, located in Naxal, Kathmandu. The responsibilities of this role include preparing and analyzing audit reports, conducting audits, evaluating financial records, and performing compliance checks. The role also involves utilizing analytical skills to identify risks, recommend process improvements, and ensure adherence to regulatory standards and company policies.

Qualifications

  • Proficiency in preparing and analyzing Audit Reports and conducting Audits
  • Experience with Audit and understanding of audit processes
  • Strong background in Finance with an understanding of financial systems and compliance
  • Excellent Analytical Skills to identify risks and propose actionable solutions
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with team members
  • Ability to work in an on-site environment and adapt to organizational requirements
  • Semi Qualified CA
  • Previous experience of 3-5 years in internal auditing or compliance is an advantage

Interested Candidates can send their CV at: vacancy@laxmiautocomp.com

Position: Sponsorship Communications and Engagement Specialist
Location: Kusunti, KC Tower, Lalitpur, Nepal

With 75 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!

Key Responsibilities:

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

RICH MEDIA and DATA MANAGEMENT:

  • Coordinate and monitor operations of all Child Sponsorship Business processes of Sponsorship 3.0 and Data management for WVI Nepal
  •  Coordinate and monitor quality, integrity, security and consistency of information generated by all Child Sponsorship 3.0 products and systems for WVI Nepal
  • Coordinate and ensure all the child media contents related to Child Sponsorship are timely captured in APs, uploaded and WV Sponsorship global rich media standard is maintained.
  •  Coordinate and monitor queries related to Child and community contents and RC data for WVI Nepal APs. Ensure queries are responded to and followed by relevant FO/APs in a timely manner. Ensure queries and feedback loops are documented and closed appropriately
  • Ensure WVI Nepal APs have latest updated media contents for capability in Auto-APR production and identify and manage data gaps in system/ child data and child media content.
  •  Manage the registered children’s data portfolio and ensure the quality and timeliness of the information of registered children including well managed RC growth of APs in Horizon Hope
  • Ensure that the reports are generated timely and shared regularly to FO/APs and timely action and follow up on GC rejected child media contents.
  • Liaise with MEAL functions to identify data discrepancies/gaps in WVI Nepal’s various systems and to work on ensuring the data are authentic and consistent in all WVI Nepal systems.
  •  Ensure that WVI Nepal’s digitalization efforts are in alignment with the Partnership communications and products standards of Child Sponsorship and Community Sponsorship
  • Manage digital upload of all community media products ensuring their quality and timeliness.
  •  Generate, analyze and establish trends based on Horizon Hope reports on RCs and submit them to Sponsorship Manager as basis for analysis and recommendation for Operations programming purpose.
  •  Manage issues and solve problems professionally to innovate simpler and efficient measures.

TEAM MANAGEMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING:

  •  Demonstrate and create conducive environment to thrieve team’s capacity and team spirit.
  •  Provide technical support and facilitate capacity building of WVI Nepal and Partner NGO staff and short-term staff to maintain quality, timeliness and understanding of all child Sponsorship and community media contents.
  •  Provide capacity building and technical support to WVI Nepal and Partner NGO staff to ensure quality, integrity, security and consistency of data input at the district level.
  •  Provide capacity building and technical support to WVI Nepal and Partner NGO staff to ensure that their performance meets minimum organizational standards relevant to systems operations.
  •  Conduct regular visits to target districts to ensure consistent processes and enable direct support when necessary
  • Identify Sponsorship Business related issues on Sponsorship 3.0 and Data management and provide problem solving or trouble shooting support to districts, or coordinate support with GC when Sponsorship Business related issues need to be escalated.
  •  Supervise and provide technical guidance, mentoring, performance management, and staff care to direct reports

EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL RELATIONSHIP FOR BUSINESS QUALITY

  • Liaise with GC/RO to identify and describe sponsor/ SOs motivations and interest in a way that helps WVI Nepal to capture RC Data and Child and Media content that meet Sponsor/ SO’s expectations
  •  Liaise with GC/RO to identify key messages to communicate to sponsors, including (i) key challenges facing children, and (ii) key programme achievements that demonstrate change in children’s lives
  •  Liaise with GC/RO/FOs/APs/PNGOs to identify modalities to work with children, families and community to help them understand the importance of collecting authentic, heart-warming and inspiring stories through Rich Media and Correspondences
  •  Manage custody of Sponsorship records of registered children in Phasing Out APs and other confidential records in coordination with IT Support at NO level.
  •  Manage the Child’s Data Quality (DQ) Review process in close coordination with GC and AP.
  • Support Sponsorship Manager to identify activities where Sponsorship Rich Media production can be aligned to best capture children’s participation and impact through WV’s programme activities.

CORRESPONDENCE MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT

  • Guide Correspondence team to facilitate capacity building of WVI Nepal and Partner NGO staff to maintain quality, timeliness and understanding of all child Sponsorship correspondences.
  •  Identify Sponsorship Correspondence related high level issues and provide problem solving or trouble shooting support to districts, or coordinate support with GC/RO/SO when the issues need to be escalated.
  • Guide Correspondence team to handle QMS management on correspondences.
  • Drive innovations and simplify processes to ensure efficient management of all Sponsorship correspondences.
  •  Support Sponsorship Manager to identify Sponsorship activities where Correspondences processing can be aligned to best capture children’s participation and impact through WV’s programmes.
  •  Identify, assess and communicate risks associated with maintenance and management of Correspondences for WVI Nepal. Coordinate mitigation measures together with NO Stakeholders, Regional office RO and GC.
  •  Ensure that all processes associated with WVI Nepal’s Child Sponsorship Correspondence Management are following organizational standards and policies.

OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Identify, assess and communicate risks associated with maintenance and management of Sponsorship 3.0 roll-out and Data management for WVI Nepal. Coordinate mitigation measures together with NO Stakeholders, RO and GC.
  • Ensure that all processes associated with WVI Nepal’s Child Sponsorship Rich Media and Data management are in compliance with organizational standards and policies
  • Contribute to strategic organizational process including annual planning, budgeting and reporting processes, and audit processes.
  • Continuously assess the efficiency, effectiveness and quality of WVI Nepal’s Child Sponsorship Communications Business related processes. Share learning and critical feedback with NO Stakeholders, RO and GC stakeholders to initiate processes for improvement
  •  Perform other organizational and business processes that are required to contribute to WVI Nepal’s strategic objectives and to maintain a healthy organizational life.
  • Increasing demonstration and understanding of and commitment to World Vision’s Core Values in the approach to work and relationships

Required Professional Experience

  •  Minimum of 4-year experience in similar or equivalent positions in development sector or Sponsorship-focused organization
  •  Experience in preparing and facilitating training, workshops
  •  Basic storytelling techniques, Child engagement techniques, critical thinking skills and communication and facilitation skills, including communicating with children and adults with respect and dignity
  •  Understanding of poverty issues, development theories and sustainable development practices including empowerment approach through community-led activities and advocacy

Required Education, training, license, registration and certification

  •  Bachelor’s degree in social science/development studies/ Sociology/ International Relation or any relevant field
  •  Strong people management skills including performance management and capacity building skills (facilitation, mentoring and coaching skills)
  • Good analytical skills; ability to critically analyze data, identify diverging and converging trends, and recommend improvement
  • Good interpersonal skills and cross-cultural sensitivity.
  •  Strong collaboration and partnership skills to mobilize engagement and influence.
  •  Computer and Technology literacy; Strong computer skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint; Strong experience in using technology including information management database software and platforms
  • User experience with WV’s data management, information platforms such as Horizon and Horizon Mobile Application

Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications

  •  Master’s degree in social science/ development studies/ Sociology/ International Relation or any relevant field
  • Knowledge of World Vision’s Technical Programmes and organizational policies and standards,
  •  including Child Sponsorship standards and Sponsorship Integration
  • World Vision’s experience in development programmes

Other Requirements

  •  Excellent written and oral communications skills including presentation and reporting skills (both English and Nepali)
  • Will be required to spend at least 60 % of work time traveling to target districts to provide technical support, capacity building and monitoring of performance

Applicant Types Accepted: Local Applicants Only

End Date: January 6, 2026

Position: Supply Chain Management Officer

Location: Hasanpur, Nepal

With 75 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!

Employee Contract Type:

Local – Fixed Term Employee (Fixed Term)

Job Description:

Procurement & Supply Chain Portfolio Management

  • Execute the entire procurement cycle from purchase request to goods receipt and reverse logistics while ensuring efficiency, compliance, and transparency.
  • Review and process Purchase Requisitions (PRs) through the Supply Chain Automation and Integration (SCAI) platform or other authorized systems.
  • Lead sourcing activities including preparation of solicitation documents, communication with potential suppliers, documentation collation, and submission of vendor recommendations to relevant authorities or the Purchase Committee.
  • Ensure all procurement bidding requirements are met for assigned purchase requests, including quotation registration, sealed bid submission, and sample verification reports.
  • Promote and expand category-based Long-Term Agreements (LTAs) at the local level, guided by the annual procurement plan and sourcing strategy.
  • Develop and regularly update a commodity catalogue for goods, works, and services procured by WVI Nepal and its Partner NGOs.
  • Establish and maintain a pre-qualified supplier database to ensure reliable sourcing and value for money.
  • Foster positive supplier relationships while upholding WVI Nepal’s core values, ethics, and procurement principles.
  • Conduct market trend analyses to inform strategic sourcing decisions and adapt to changing business environments.
  • Contribute to capacity building of Partner NGOs to strengthen compliance, enhance procurement skills, and promote strategic sourcing practices.

Risk Management, Compliance/Review & Support

  • Ensure the Block Party Screening (BPS) before the process of procurement as per WVI Nepal Procurement manual.
  • Conduct Supplier Orientation working with NGO Partners
  • Managing contracting and evaluating the effective implementation according to agreed terms and conditions
  • Support to mitigate the SCM risk and establish the control to improve the existing process and practice.
  • Occasional field visits to monitor PNGO and implementing area to ensure the fair distribution.
  • Assist to increase the cost savings through healthy negotiation and ensure to effective and efficient service and fast and flexible.

Reporting and Analysis

  • Prepare and submit periodic updates on procurement status, including PR tracking, purchase order progress, and contract implementation summaries for the Supply Chain Management & Admin Coordinator.
  • Report on the status of procurement documentation, highlighting compliance with standard procedures, use of approved templates, and areas requiring follow-up or corrective action.
  • Compile and share reports on supplier performance, market trends, and pricing updates to support strategic sourcing and informed decision-making.

Required Professional Experience

  • At least 3 years’ experience in the field of procurement and supply chain management
  • At least three years of professional experience in the field of humanitarian and development work.

Required Education, training, license, registration and certification

  • Bachelor’s degree in management, Business Administration, Procurement, or a related field

Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications

  • Sound understanding of procurement and supply chain management principles and practices.
  • Strong computer literacy with proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Internet tools).
  • Excellent command of both English and Nepali languages, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to articulate and present ideas clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing.
  • Practical experience and applied knowledge in procurement and supply chain operations.
  • Familiarity with global supply chain standards, financial systems, and procedural requirements.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively utilize digital platforms and technologies

Applicant Types Accepted: Local Applicants Only

End Date: JJanuary 6, 2026

Position: IT Assistant

Location: Hasanpur

With 75 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!

Key Responsibilities:

Service Desk, Service Level Management and Service Improvement

  • First point of contact and day-to-day technical support to end users.
  • Keep all IT equipment in working condition and install / configure them for customer use.
  • Responds to Level 1 and Level 2 support and works with vendors on Level 3 support.
  • Research troubleshoots issues which affect multiple clients.
  • Works with vendor technical support personnel on solutions for clients.
  • Collaborates in the development of service-level objectives and takes steps to meet or exceed targets.
  • Monitors service-level objectives to ensure that requirements are met or exceeded.
  • Follows up in a timely manner to ensure customer satisfaction.
  • Reviews tracking log to identify recurring problems, or problems affecting a large number of clients.
  • Recommends solutions to common problems and updates frequently asked questions documentation.
  • Identifies customer training needs based on common problems.

Technical Support

  • Keep all technical resources available for meetings that include video conferencing and provide support whenever required.
  • Engages the hardware vendors on issues to remedy issues or escalates for support.
  • Diagnoses and resolves IT equipment’s and mobile devices hardware and software issues.
  • Replace spare parts to make it workable by coordinating with supply chain department.
  • Creates temporary solutions until permanent solutions can be implemented.
  • Coordinates the resolution of escalated application, hardware and software problems.
  • Maintain and support electrical and power backup.

Field Visit

  • Frequently visit WVI Nepal field offices for the purpose to fix technical issues.
  • Perform yearly health checkup of IT equipment’s placed at WVI Nepal field offices and owned by WVI Nepal.

Inventory Management

  • Maintains IT inventory management for all IT equipment and/or software in accordance with company policy and procedures.
  • Administrate end point and mobile device management portal and ensure it is up to date.
  • Maintain IT equipment’s in stock.

Documentation

  • Creates, modifies and reviews documentation of issues resolutions.
  • Develops and delivers documentation to ensure appropriate end-user support.
  • Creates and submits documented resolution to Knowledge Base.
  • Updates manuals/guides to incorporate new recommended products.
  • Prepare report after IT equipment’s health checkup.

KNOWLEDGE/QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE ROLE

Required Professional Experience

  • At least 6 moths to 1 years working experience in technology field in terms of providing customer support.
  • Experience on help desk system.
  • Hands-on experience with computer hardware, software installation, and troubleshooting.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and work under supervision.

Required Education, training, license, registration and certification

  • At least bachelor degree in information technology, computer engineering or relevant technology field.

Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of computer networking (LAN/Wi-Fi, IP configuration, printer sharing).
  • Familiarity with Windows, Microsoft 365, and mobile device setup.
  • Eagerness to learn new technologies and have problem solving nature.

Applicant Types Accepted: Local Applicants Only

End Date: January 6, 2026

Position: SCM Officer

Location: Kusunti, KC Tower, Lalitpur,

With 75 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!

Key Responsibilities:

Job Objective:

  • This position is responsible for execution of sourcing process until the payment process on all requisitions for goods, works and services across all commodity categories to ensure general purchases and supplier relationship are carried out in alignment with WVIN Procurement Policies.
  • Researches and evaluates requests based on price, service, quality and warranty and other applicable criteria in order to deliver and execute complex strategic sourcing projects.
  • This position will work closely with the technical and non-technical staffs in National Office in order to acquire appropriate and quality goods and services as per the specific requirements in order to implement projects. The incumbent will also support Field
  • Offices for centralized procurement and other procurement that are infeasible and complicated to be carried out at field level.
  • The incumbent will adopt strategies to meet department goals and provide relevant information and recommendations to the management for proper decision making.
  • He/she will also assist in the development of high standard of accountability and transparency in procurement of goods and services.

Accurate and up-to-date asset records with proper tagging and insurance, and timely support to field offices for compliance and audit readiness.

  • Collect and verify asset details for insurance coverage; support renewal and claims documentation.
  • Help with barcode tagging of new assets and maintain accurate records in the asset register.
  • Enter and validate asset data in the web-based application; ensure timely updates for transfers and disposals.
  • Provide guidance and remote support to field offices on tagging, verification, and asset movement processes.
  • Participate in periodic physical verification exercises and prepare summary reports for compliance and audit readiness.
  • Understanding of smooth execution via automation and ICT Proficiency
  • Conduct end-to-end procurement transactions using automation system – SCAI, ensuring accuracy and compliance with WVIN policies.
  • Regularly update and validate procurement data in automation- SCAI to maintain system integrity, troubleshoot and resolve automation-related issues promptly, escalating complex cases to IT support.
  • Support requesters and other staff on Automation functionalities for requisition, sourcing, and reporting.
  • Use data visualization tools (Excel Pivot, Power BI, or similar) to analyze procurement trends and spending patterns.
  • Apply ICT tools for electronic bid evaluation and secure document handling.
  • Managing Purchasing Requisition, Executing and Solicitation of Sourcing Methods and Implement Strategic Sourcing
  • Identifying viable customer alternatives and facilitating access to the ‘best value for money’ for all products and services;
  • Develop Commodity Catalogue for relevant categories/sub-categories;
  • Ensure major / recurring procurements are under strategic sourcing initiative;
  • Lead to establish the supplier’s data base on pre- qualification process in order to meet the organization’s needs;
  • Propose innovative solutions to increase efficacy through evidence-based analysis for consumption by financial and operational dimensions, including price, quality and service;
  • Support in Improving spending behavior, process, utilization, and optimize total throughput yield
  • Lead in implementation and execution of sourcing process including preparing solicitation documents, sending documents to preferred/potential suppliers, collating all necessary documents and recommending vendors/suppliers to relevant authorities including Purchasing Committee (PC).
  • Ensure procurement biddings requirement is in place for assigned purchase request (quotation registration from, sealed bids, sample verification report etc)
  • Contacts and receives informal quotes from appropriate suppliers; compares costs and evaluates the quality and suitability of equipment, materials and supplies
  • Participate in the development of specifications for equipment, products or substitute materials.
  • Communicate processes and update status to key stakeholders.

Contract Management

  • Assist to increase the cost saving through healthy negotiation and ensure to effective and efficient service and fast and flexible.
  • Lead negotiations for strategic and large supplier contracts for the procurement of office supplies, airline tickets, security and janitorial services, and others. Negotiating favorable pricing, contractual terms & conditions and manage contracts.
  • Monitor and improve contracts to make sure what is in the agreements is being achieved and contract gaps are eliminated in consultation with Legal experts.
  • Manage long term supplier relationships for designated categories.
  • Maintain the supplier intimacy without compromising the ethics and value of WVIN.

Payment/Invoice Processing

  • Process Vendor’s Invoices by monitoring discount opportunities; and forward to assigned procurement staff for further process.
  • Coordinates purchasing details with supplier including pricing revisions, order cancellation and invoice discrepancies.
  • Oversee the payments and controls expenses by receiving, processing, verifying, and all reconciling invoices.
  • Reconciles processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
  • Resolving purchase order, contract, invoice, or payment discrepancies and documentation.

Risk Management, Compliance and Review

  • Prepare comparison sheets and share relevant information to PC for their review and prepare necessary documentation.
  • Proper filing and documentation of all procurement activities as per WVIN guidelines and audit standards.
  • Ensure the Block Party Screening (BPS) before process of procurement as per WVIN Procurement manual.
  • Ensure WVIN compliance with the 7R.
  • Prepare half yearly/Yearly supplier’s performance evaluation and update the supplier database/consultant roster accordingly.
  • Suggest ways to deal with procurement challenges in adherence to WVIN procurement guidelines.

Reporting and Analysis

  • Ensure correct data are fed to SCAI/ relevant authorized systems.
  • Maintains all records of purchases with supporting documents (Keep all documents with separate file).
  • Monthly Management Report.
  • Participates in issue resolution, prepare issue reports and escalate issues early and appropriately.

Required Professional Experience

  • Effective Communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proven experience as a team player
  • Demonstrated collaboration & team building skills
  • Strong knowledge of Procure-to-Pay processes.
  • Demonstrated integrity and probity in all procurement activities.

Required Education, training, license, registration and certification

  • At least bachelor’s degree in business/management or other relevant field.

Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications

  • At least 1 year of working experience in Procurement Management/Finance/ Office Administration.
  • Understanding and experience about Nepal Government’s strategies, policies, guidelines, plans about Procurement Management
  • Ability to identify the Procurement Management issues at National Level
  • Competent in the use of Microsoft Office computer programs including Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Applicant Types Accepted: Local Applicants Only

End Date: January 6, 2026

title.rendered: Admin and Finance Officer, Project Officer, Project Coordinator, Technical Officer, Monitoring and Evaluation Officer

content.rendered:
SOS Children’s Villages Nepal, a non-governmental social development organisation, supports children without parental care and families in difficult living conditions through services in care, education, health and emergency relief. We advocate for the rights of children and young people, in alliance with a great diversity of partners. We offer a secure and friendly work environment and are committed to safeguarding the rights of children by having zero tolerance policy in this regard. We are further committed to providing a safe environment for coworkers and children, young people and adults with whom we work, where human rights are respected and upheld, and healthy relations are fostered by building organisational systems, capacity, and awareness on our Child and Youth Safeguarding Policy and Code of Conduct. We are now looking for interested and qualified individuals for the following positions within the “Promoting Equitable Access to Education and Holistic Child Development in Patarasi” project in Patarasi Rural Municipality of Jumla district.

Job positions:

Project Coordinator: 1 Full-time (Based in Patarasi Rural Municipality)

The Project Coordinator plays a pivotal role in overseeing all aspects of the initiative. This position requires strong organisational, leadership and interpersonal skills, along with a deep understanding of the programme’s core areas. The role involves ensuring the effective implementation of the community-based family strengthening programme in collaboration with diverse stakeholders, while also requiring the ability to adapt and provide solutions in dynamic situations.

Key performance areas and main responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and contractors to develop and align the programme plan, ensuring consistency with project objectives.
  • Lead and support activity planning and implementation at the municipality level, maintaining effective communication with local stakeholders.
  • Oversee budget planning, school construction, project execution, and staff administration; facilitate the development of a robust monitoring and evaluation framework; and prepare comprehensive progress reports for timely submission.
  • Provide technical guidance to team members and address capacity-building needs to ensure effective programme implementation.
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with government agencies, community leaders, and other key stakeholders.

Qualifications, experience and skills:

  • A minimum of a Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., development studies, social sciences, public health, education, employability/entrepreneurship, etc.), with at least second division or equivalent from a recognised university.
  • A minimum of five years’ experience in programme management and coordination, including construction-related projects, with a focus on child development, child protection, education, livelihood, WASH, health, nutrition, and local governance.
  • Demonstrated expertise in policies, regulations, and frameworks related to children, including alternative care guidelines, with a proven track record in local-level stakeholder engagement, partnership building, and resource mobilisation.
  • Strong communication skills in English and Nepali, with proficiency in computer applications, including report writing.
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude.

Project Officer: 1 Full-time (Based in Patarasi Rural Municipality)

The Project Officer, under the supervision of the Project Coordinator, supports the planning and execution of the Project. This position entails coordinating and implementing field-level activities in collaboration with Community Mobilisers to achieve programme goals and adhere to timelines.

Key performance areas and main responsibilities:

  • Support the Project Coordinator in planning, implementing, and monitoring programme activities at the municipality level, including developing and maintaining family development plans for target families and coordinating service delivery.
  • Maintain regular communication with target children and families, organise and manage community mobilisers, and ensure timely collection and management of documentation updates.
  • Collaborate with local networks and advocacy groups to promote and protect the rights of targeted children.
  • Compile monthly progress reports in consultation with community mobilisers.
  • Stay updated on project activities and changes in policies related to children at national, provincial, and local levels to ensure alignment and compliance within the programme scope.

Qualifications, experience and skills:

  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., development studies, social sciences, public health, education, employability/entrepreneurship, etc.) with at least a second division or equivalent from a recognised university.
  • A minimum of three years of experience in community-level programme implementation.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Nepali, with proficiency in computer applications and report writing.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude.
  • Preference will be given to local candidates who understand the local language.
  • Preference will be given to candidates holding a two-wheeler license.

Technical Officer (Civil Overseer): 1 Full-time (Based in Patarasi Rural Municipality)

The Technical Officer (Civil Overseer) works under the supervision of the Project Coordinator and the Civil Engineer at the National Office. This position is responsible for supervising, monitoring and reporting on all construction activities for the school buildings in Jumla, ensuring compliance with design specifications, quality standards, safety norms, and timelines.

Key performance areas and main responsibilities:

  • Develop plans for daily supervision, monitoring, material verification, and reporting of construction activities to ensure compliance with approved drawings, specifications, quality standards, and contract requirements.
  • Ensure all required tests are conducted according to Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) plans; maintain records of test results and certificates, including construction compliance monitoring.
  • Maintain coordination between the Contractor and Civil Engineer at the National Office on technical matters; assist in scheduling and sequencing; report construction delays, site issues, or non-conformities; participate in site meetings and contribute to progress and quality reviews; coordinate with local government officials and the school management committee, as required.
  • Ensure effective progress monitoring and reporting in compliance with safety protocols and local building regulations; oversee implementation of safety signage, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), and good housekeeping practices.
  • Maintain logs of daily activities and prepare weekly summary reports on progress, quality, and coordination; regularly report progress and challenges to the Project Coordinator.

Qualifications, experience and skills:

  • Diploma in Civil Engineering.
  • A minimum of three years’ experience in building construction supervision (experience in school or institutional projects will be given priority).
  • Knowledge of construction materials, techniques, and quality control.
  • Familiarity with local building codes and safety standards.
  • Ability to work in remote locations and manage multiple tasks effectively.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Nepali, with proficiency in computer applications.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and a positive attitude.
  • Preference will be given to local candidates and those holding a two-wheeler license.

Admin and Finance Officer: 1 Full-time (Based in Patarasi Rural Municipality)

The Admin and Finance Officer, under the direct supervision of the Project Coordinator, maintains financial discipline through proper accounting. This role involves preparing financial reports, managing day-to-day transactions, conducting budget analysis and overseeing budget control and monitoring.

Key performance areas and main responsibilities:

  • Oversee office operations, including logistics for field visits, management of correspondence, and facility maintenance.
  • Support to organise programme events, and oversee budget preparation, financial transactions, statements, payroll and coworkers’ benefits.
  • Maintain records, ensures compliance with local tax laws, files tax returns, and monitors cash flow for financial stability.
  • Manage office supplies, implements security measures, analyse financial data for insights and handle petty cash and reimbursements.

Qualifications, experience and skills:

  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Business Studies, Business Management, or a related field with specialisation in Financial Management, with at least a second division or equivalent from a recognised university.
  • At least three years of work experience in a similar role, with a focus on administrative responsibilities.
  • Proficiency in office management, organisational operations, and accounting software.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Nepali, with proficiency in computer applications.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with training in D365, Power BI, FAMAS, accounting, taxation, and financial reporting.
  • Preference will be given to candidates who understand the local language.

Monitoring and Evaluation Officer: 1 Full time (Based in Patarasi Rural Municipality)

The Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Officer, under the direct supervision of the Project Coordinator, plays a vital role in overseeing and ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of the programme. This position involves diverse responsibilities focusing on progress tracking, assessing, and reporting programme results to ensure the programme achievements align with set objectives.

Key performance areas and main responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement a comprehensive Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework aligned with project objectives and indicators, including detailed plans for data collection methodologies and tools.
  • Establish data collection systems, oversee the regular gathering of quantitative and qualitative data from diverse sources, ensure proper storage and security of data, and analyse findings to identify insights and areas for improvement.
  • Prepare periodic progress reports based on M&E findings, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) for each programme component to support overall progress reporting.
  • Facilitate orientation and supervise data collection tasks carried out by coworkers at the municipality level.

Qualifications, experience and skills:

  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., development studies, social sciences, public health, education, economics etc.) with at least a second division or its equivalent.
  • A minimum of three years of experience in the monitoring and evaluation sector in result-framework, reviewing and analysing the data, conduct need assessment of the projects, writing concept notes and progress reports.
  • Excellent communication skills in both English and Nepali, along with proficiency in computer applications.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and a positive attitude.
  • Preference will be given to local and candidates having a two–wheeler license

Salary and other benefits: As per the policies of the organisation.

Interested candidates are requested to apply with a Cover Letter, Curriculum Vitae, Copies of Academic Certificates, (equivalence from relevant government agencies if studied out of Nepal), Copy of Citizenship Certificate, a passport size photo and the Employment Application Form (mandatory document to be downloaded from here) to: vacancy@sosnepal.org.np by 5: 00 pm, December 31, 2025.

Note: Please clearly mention the name of the project and the position you are applying for in your cover letter.

SOS Children’s Villages Nepal reserves the right to reject any or all the applications without assigning any reason whatsoever. SOS Children’s Villages Nepal follows the Inclusive Policy and therefore encourages women, people with disabilities, people of ethnic minorities and marginalised communities to apply.

content.rendered:
Project: Accessing Education to Child Laborers in Domestic and Commercial Sector in Nepal (ACCESS) Project

Implementing Organization: Child Nepal

Funding: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)

Child Nepal, in collaboration with the OHCHR/UNVTF, is implementing the “Accessing Education to Child Laborers in Domestic and Commercial Sector in Nepal (ACCESS)” project. The project aims to improve access to education, psychosocial support, and protection services for child laborers in domestic and commercial sectors in Budanilkantha Municipality, Kathmandu. Child Nepal invites applications from qualified, committed, and motivated Nepali citizens for the following full-time positions:

1. Program Coordinator

Duty Station: Kathmandu (with field visits)

Duration: January 2026 – December 2026 (with possibility of extension)

Reports to: Executive Director

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide overall leadership and coordination of the ACCESS Project.
  • Ensure effective and timely project implementation in line with project objectives and donor requirements.
  • Coordinate with OHCHR, local governments, schools, and relevant stakeholders.
  • Lead project planning, monitoring, reporting, and documentation.
  • Supervise project staff and support capacity-building activities.
  • Ensure child protection, safeguarding, gender equality, and inclusion principles are integrated into project activities.
  • Represent Child Nepal in coordination meetings and relevant forums.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences, Education, Development Studies, or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in child rights, education, or child labor–related projects.
  • Experience working with UN agencies or international organizations is highly desirable.
  • Strong leadership, coordination, and report-writing skills.
  • Fluency in English and Nepali (written and spoken).

2. Accountant

Duty Station: Kathmandu

Duration: January 2026 – December 2026

Reports to: Program Coordinator / Finance Manager

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintain accurate financial records for the ACCESS Project.
  • Prepare vouchers, ledgers, bank reconciliations, and financial statements.
  • Ensure compliance with organizational policies and donor financial guidelines.
  • Support timely preparation of financial reports for OHCHR.
  • Assist with audits and financial reviews.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Intermediate level or Bachelor’s degree (preferred) in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in accounting for NGO/INGO projects.
  • Knowledge of donor-funded project financial management.
  • Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

3. Psychosocial Counselor (Full-Time)

Duty Station: Kathmandu

Duration: January 2026 – December 2026

Reports to: Program Coordinator

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide psychosocial counseling and emotional support to child laborers and their families.
    Conduct individual and group counseling sessions for children.
  • Identify children requiring specialized mental health services and facilitate referrals.
  • Support awareness activities related to child protection, mental wellbeing, and education.
  • Maintain confidential case records and reports.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Education, Psychology, Counseling, Social Work, or related field.
  • At least 2 years of experience in psychosocial support, preferably with children.
  • Training in child protection, trauma-informed care, or counseling is an asset.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

4. Social Mobilizer

Duty Station: Kathmandu

Duration: January 2026 – December 2026

Reports to: Program Coordinator

Key Responsibilities:

  • Mobilize communities, parents, and children to promote access to education.
  • Support identification, enrollment, and follow-up of child laborers.
  • Coordinate with schools, community leaders, and local stakeholders.
  • Conduct awareness and advocacy activities on child labor and education.
  • Support data collection and reporting at the community level.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Intermediate or Bachelor’s level education in Social Work, Education, or related field.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in community mobilization or social development work.
  • Familiarity with child labor and education-related interventions.
  • Willingness to work extensively in the field.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are requested to submit an updated CV and a cover letter clearly mentioning the position applied for to: vacancychildnepal@gmail.com

Deadline: 28 December 2025

Child Nepal is an equal opportunity employer. Women, members of marginalized communities, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

About Organization – Asha Nepal is a non-governmental organization (NGO) dedicated to supporting women and children whose lives have been deeply affected by gender-based violence. Its work focuses on issues such as human trafficking, domestic violence, rape and sexual abuse, HIV/AIDS, and child labor and domestic slavery. Through a comprehensive approach that includes prevention, rescue, education, and healthcare, Asha Nepal strives to improve the overall well-being of survivors. The organization’s mission is to help survivors of violence-women, children, and families rebuild their lives socially, emotionally, and economically. By fostering safety, independence, and dignity, Asha Nepal enables them to reclaim their place as valued members of their communities and society. Asha Nepal is committed to strengthening the social, economic, and educational status of women and children, empowering them to break free from the cycle of abuse and violence.

Position: Social Worker

No. of Vacancy: 1

Job Location: Dhapasi – Tokha (Kathmandu Valley – community-based field work)

Job Type: Full Time

Offered Salary: Negotiable (as per Asha Nepal’s policy)

Commitment Period: Must be willing to commit for a minimum period of 2-3 years.

Apply Before: 16th Jan, 2026

A Social Worker at Asha Nepal works with children and families affected by gender-based violence who are facing social exclusion or family crisis. The role focuses on supporting them to achieve safety, stability, and well-being. With the aim of ensuring that families can remain safe and stable within their communities, the Social Worker helps children access regular academic and vocational education. Working in close coordination with families, the Social Worker provides timely and appropriate support to prevent family separation and strengthen family resilience.

Job Description / Responsibilities

  • To listen attentively and understand each situation, identify and prioritize needs plan appropriate actions, recommend the best course of action to the case management team, make informed decisions, and ensure timely delivery of services to service users.
  • To visit families in their residence or contact them by phone at least once a month to have their updates and provide needed support to them.
  • To visit children and their schools to know about their education and educational progress.
  • Maintain case notes, assessments, follow-up forms, and reports as per organizational standards.
  • To help families find job and ensure that they have regular source of income to look after their families.
  • To conduct informal interviews with children and families to assess and review their situation and work in the process of case the close in needed.
  • Prepare monthly plans, monthly reports, and half-yearly program reports
  • Co-ordinate closely with Case Manager and relevant community stakeholders
  • Liaise with external agencies and make referrals when required
  • Participate in case management meetings and regular staff meetings.
  • To participate in meetings and workshops with like-minded organizations and alliance networks as required.
  • Ensure all work is conducted in line with the Best Interest of the Child, Child Protection Policy, and PAM(Personnel and Administration Manual) of Asha Nepal

Job Specification

Education: Bachelor’s degree running or completed in Social Work or Sociology

Experience: Freshers are strongly encouraged to apply

Skills & Competencies:

  • Honest, empathetic, non-judgmental, and culturally sensitive
  • Strong communication, listening, and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently while maintaining professional boundaries
  • High sense of integrity and confidentiality
  • Task-oriented with flexibility to work in community settings

Other Requirements:

  • Must be a valid two-wheeler driving license holder
  • Willingness to work flexible hours when required

How to Apply – Interested candidates meeting the above criteria are requested to submit:

  • Updated CV
  • Cover Letter

Email: contactashanepal@gmail.com & finance.ashanepal@gmail.com

Subject Line: Application for Social Worker

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Asha Nepal encourages applications from women and individuals from marginalized communities.

Disclaimer: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of the skills, efforts, duties, and responsibilities associated with this position. Staff members may be required to perform additional professional duties as assigned by the organization.

Rastriya RojgarPrawardhan Kendra (RRPK) is an NGO dedicated to developing rural communities in Education, Health & Nutrition, Child Protection, Livelihood, Human Rights, Safer Migration, gender and empowerment, good governance, Disaster Risk Reduction and WASH in Nepal since 2004. It works with a mission to improve the lives of people through economic, social, cultural and physical transformation. It has been implementing Samunnati (Sponsorship) Program in Sarlahi District since 2017 in partnership with Save the Children.

Rastriya RojgarPrawardhan Kendra invites applications from the interested and eligible candidates (Nepali citizen only) for the following position under Samunnati (Sponsorship) Program.

Position: Field Officer (Education) – 2

Term: Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Project Coordinator-Education

Location: Malangawa, Sarlahi

Working Area: Godaita and Balara Municipality

Purpose of the Role

The position holder will be responsible for the management of sponsorship Education program, including planning, budgeting, forecasting, financial and project tracking, implementation, monitoring and supervision, technical backstopping, data and information management, and reporting under education theme.

The position holder will provide technical leadership and capacity-building support to teachers, school management bodies, ECCD facilitators, children, parents, and key education stakeholders. In addition, the role includes coaching, mentoring, and supervisory support to community mobilizers, teachers, and community volunteers facilitating education interventions in schools and communities.

The position holder will also lead and support training, assessments, surveys, research activities, documentation of lessons learned, best practices, and success stories, and ensure timely sharing with project teams, donor agencies, and relevant stakeholders. Furthermore, the role will support senior project coordinators and field coordinators as required, ensuring that program decisions and actions serve the best interests of children.

Key Responsibilities

1. Technical Leadership

  • Provide technical guidance to teachers and facilitators on ECCD teaching and learning methodologies, Literacy Boost and Numeracy Boost approaches, School Leadership and Management (SLaM), Recovery and Accelerated Learning (ReAL) Plans, integrated curricula and education protocols.
  • Familiar with inclusive education policies, plans and implementation approaches.
    Able to align project interventions with national inclusive and quality education strategies, standards, protocols, and School Education Sector Plan (SESP).
  • Ensure high-quality implementation of community and school-based interventions in accordance with the sponsorship Detailed Implementation Plan (DIP) and log-frame.

2. Field Engagement and Support

  • The position holder will take primary accountability for field-level program implementation, allocating approximately 70% of his/her time to fieldwork, 20% to desk-based work, and 10% to local level coordination, networking, reporting and documentation.
  • Conduct routine monitoring visits to schools, ECCD centers, school-at-home initiatives, and education related sessions.
  • Provide on-site coaching, mentoring, technical support, and problem-solving to strengthen service delivery.

3. Joint Monitoring & Coordination

  • Organize and participate in joint monitoring visits with municipal, district/provincial authorities, and project teams.
  • Follow up on monitoring findings and ensure timely corrective actions for quality improvement.
  • Track progress in service delivery, referral pathways, and coordination mechanisms.

4. Project Implementation & Delivery

  • Lead the implementation of education program activities in line with the sponsorship annual plan (SAP) and Detailed Implementation Plan (DIP).
  • Facilitate education-related trainings, workshops, meetings, orientations, and seminars at schools and community levels.
  • Ensure all education activities adhere to agreed quality benchmarks, implementation procedures, and donor approved log-framework.
  • Plan and ensure the timely procurement and distribution of education-related materials to support effective program delivery.
  • Ensure timely and appropriate delivery of educational goods and services to targeted schools and communities.

5. Supervision, Coaching & Capacity Building

  • Coordinate and facilitate training for Teachers, SMCs, PTAs and Parents with disability, Education facilitators.
  • Provide on-site coaching during field visits and ensure effective transfer of skills and knowledge.
  • Monitor improvements in facilitator competencies and the quality of services delivered.

6. Reporting, Monitoring & Documentation

  • Prepare and submit event reports, quarterly reports, semi-annual and annual reports, and donor reports in line with agreed timelines and formats .
  • Ensure compliance with donor reporting requirements, and procedures.
  • Conduct semi-annual and annual result reviews, share challenges and opportunities, and develop action plans to improve indicator performance.
  • Conduct regular quality monitoring visits against quality benchmarks and report to the line manager on monthly basis.
  • Conduct joint monitoring, technical monitoring, output monitoring, whole school/ECCD monitoring, school/ECCD observation, distribution monitoring, follow up monitoring and supportive supervision monitoring visits for effective and efficient delivery of education programs at field.
  • Ensure functional complaint and feedback mechanisms at schools, communities, and program sites.
  • Lead and support surveys, assessments, research, and mapping exercises related to education.
  • Ensure timely data collection, entry, coding, cleaning, analysis, and reporting through online/offline databases.
  • Update baseline, plans, and achievements in Online Program Management Information System on a monthly basis.
  • Document and disseminate good practices, best practices, lesson learned, and success stories related to sponsorship program.
  • Assist field staff and program coordinators in developing tools, templates, and guidance materials for effective management and implementation of sponsorship program.
  • Verify the accuracy, reliability, timeliness, and completeness of data submitted by field staff, schools, ECCD centers.
  • Maintain monitoring log, issues log, education database, case studies and other relevant documentation for program visibility, learning and accountability.

7. Financial Compliance & Resource Management

  • Lead planning, budgeting, forecasting, and financial tracking of education theme under sponsorship program.
  • Develop annual budget, detailed implementation plan, and quarterly forecasts in coordination with donor and partners.
  • Prepare education procurement plan, media and communication plan, and sponsorship annual plan as and when required by funding partner.
  • Track plan versus achievement, budget versus expenditure and procurement progress on monthly basis for education theme.
  • Identify and justify any budget variances or deviations and propose corrective actions.

8. Teamwork, Conduct & Communication

  • Promote effective teamwork, coordination, and communication across technical and administrative teams.
  • Uphold professional conduct, ethical behavior, and responsiveness to feedback.
  • Contribute to donor communications, review meetings, and project strategy discussions.
  • Promote and ensure adherence to safeguarding principles within the Samunnati (Sponsorship) Program.

9. Compliance, Branding & Audit Preparedness

  • Ensure proper branding and visibility of IEC materials, reports, and event materials.
  • Maintain complete and organized documentation for all project activities.
  • Support preparation for donor visits, reviews, and audits.

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in education, Sociology, or a related field with at least three years of relevant experience or a master’s degree in education or a related field with at least two years of experience.
  • Ability to facilitate relevant trainings, workshops, meetings, and seminars.
  • Strong skills in program planning, budgeting, and operational management.
  • Sound understanding of monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning (MEAL).
  • Experience coordinating with local governments, provincial authorities, and district line agencies.
  • Strong communication and computer skills, including word, excel, power point, email and internet use.
  • Excellent report-writing skills in both Nepali and English.
  • Willingness to reside and work in program implementation sites.
  • Ability to work respectfully and effectively in diverse cultural and social contexts and backgrounds.

Key Competencies

  • Strong technical expertise in ECCD and Basic Education programming
  • Program planning, coordination, and implementation skills
  • Supportive supervision, mentoring, and coaching abilities
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Strong organizational, documentation, and reporting skills
  • Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with local governments, teachers, SMCs, PTA and team members.
  • High commitment to ethical conduct, transparency, and accountability.
  • Valid driving license with the ability to travel frequently using a personal two-wheeler.

Position: Junior Technical Assistant (JTA) –1

Term: Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Field Coordinator-Livelihood

Location :Malangawa, Sarlahi

Working Area: Godaita and Balara Municipality

Purpose of the Role

The position holder will be responsible for carries out a range of responsibilities in the areas of Child Sensitive Livelihood (CSL) in the structures of impact area as well as Community Mobilization. S/He have to supervise all the Farmer group members, MEs, VTs & assist to Field Coordinator in program activities especially in the CSL activities, program planning, budgeting, forecasting, implementation, monitoring/supervision and reporting of the project.

The position holder will also lead and support training, assessments, surveys, research activities, documentation of lessons learned, best practices, and success stories, and ensure timely sharing with project teams, donor agencies, and relevant stakeholders. Furthermore, the role will support senior project coordinators and field coordinators as required, ensuring that program decisions and actions serve the best interests of children.

Key Responsibilities

1.Technical Leadership

  • Provide technical guidance to Farmers, farmer field school, MEs, VTs and facilitators on life skill sessions.
  • Familiar with organic farming, post harvesting and production management, IPM kit and modern agriculture technologies as well as climate justice village modality.
  • Ensure high-quality implementation of on-farm and off-farm interventions in accordance with the sponsorship Detailed Implementation Plan (DIP) and log-frame.

2. Field Engagement and Support

  • The JTA is 100% accountable and responsible for field-based implementation, program management and reporting. S/He will manage his/her 100% time for implementation and management of field-based intervention including field visit and support Field Coordinator for reporting, local level and district based coordination and networking.
  • Conduct routine monitoring visits to farmer groups, MEs, VTs and related sessions.
  • Provide on-site coaching, mentoring, technical support, and problem-solving to strengthen service delivery.

3. Joint Monitoring & Coordination

  • Support in conduction and participation in joint monitoring visits with municipal, district/provincial authorities, and project teams.
  • Follow up on monitoring findings and ensure timely corrective actions for quality improvement.
  • Track progress in service delivery, referral pathways, and coordination mechanisms.

4.Project Implementation & Delivery

  • Support to the Field Coordinator in planning, implementation, monitoring & evaluation, reporting and management of CSL related Activities.
  • Day to Day Onsite coaching and technical support to farmer group and other CSL groups
  • Work closely with and in the guidance of Livelihood Coordinator (FC) in supporting planning and implementing integrated on farm and off farm activities at the community level.
  • Involve in selection of Local Resource Persons and forming different groups using PLA tool
  • Support for the selection of target households for immediate support.
  • Assist for timely preparation of quarterly/annual plan with targets, budget and timeframe of the field level activities.
  • Assist Livelihood Coordinator (FC) in carrying out needs assessments on training, input support and other nutrition promoting activities.
  • Assist a Livelihood Coordinator (FC) for focus group discussions and meetings with organized farmers groups on performance of project.
  • Conduct Farmers field School on integrated farming.
  • Maintain database and records on field level project activities and accomplishments and report to agriculture officers
  • Support to manage timely supply of inputs with improved technologies and skill to farmers groups.
  • Coordinate with the community level and related stakeholders.
  • Ensure cross-cutting issues such as gender and inclusion mainstreamed throughout the project cycle.

5. Supervision, Coaching & Capacity Building

  • Coordinate and facilitate training for Farmer group members, MEs, VTs and session facilitators.
  • Provide on-site coaching during field visits and ensure effective transfer of skills and knowledge.
  • Monitor improvements in famers, MEs, VTs and facilitator competencies and the quality of services delivered.

6. Reporting, Monitoring & Documentation

  • Prepare and submit event reports, support field coordinator in quarterly , semi-annual and annual, and donor reports in line with agreed timelines and formats .
  • Conduct semi-annual and annual result reviews, share challenges and opportunities, and develop action plans to improve indicator performance.
  • Conduct regular quality monitoring visits against quality benchmarks and report to the line manager on monthly basis.
  • Conduct joint monitoring, technical monitoring, output monitoring, whole Farmer groups, MEs, VTs distribution monitoring, follow up monitoring and supportive supervision monitoring visits for effective and efficient production and economic empowerment at field.
  • Ensure functional complaint and feedback mechanisms at schools, communities, and program sites.
  • Lead and support surveys, assessments, research, and mapping exercises related to education.
  • Document and disseminate good practices, best practices, lesson learned, and success stories related to sponsorship program.
  • Assist field staff and program coordinators in developing tools, templates, and guidance materials for effective management and implementation of sponsorship program.

7. Financial Compliance & Resource Management

  • Assist in planning, budgeting, forecasting, and financial tracking of child poverty theme under sponsorship program.
  • Assist in Preparation of Child Poverty procurement plan, media and communication plan, and sponsorship annual plan as and when required by funding partner.

8. Teamwork, Conduct & Communication

  • Promote effective teamwork, coordination, and communication across technical and administrative teams.
  • Uphold professional conduct, ethical behavior, and responsiveness to feedback.
  • Contribute to donor communications, review meetings, and project strategy discussions.
  • Promote and ensure adherence to safeguarding principles within the Samunnati (Sponsorship) Program.

9. Compliance, Branding & Audit Preparedness

  • Ensure proper branding and visibility of IEC materials, reports, and event materials.
  • Maintain complete and organized documentation for all project activities.
  • Support preparation for donor visits, reviews, and audits.

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • JTA graduate or I. SC ag completed with minimum of 3 years experience in field.
  • Ability to facilitate relevant trainings, workshops, meetings, and seminars.
  • Strong skills in program planning, budgeting, and operational management.
  • Sound understanding of monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning (MEAL).
  • Strong communication skills, including word, excel, power point, email and internet use.
  • Excellent report-writing skills in both Nepali and English.
  • Willingness to reside and work in program implementation sites.
  • Ability to work respectfully and effectively in diverse cultural and social contexts and backgrounds.

Key Competencies

  • Strong technical expertise in On-farm and off-farm programming
  • Program planning, coordination, and implementation skills
  • Supportive supervision, mentoring, and coaching abilities
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Strong organizational, documentation, and reporting skills
  • Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with farmers, MEs, VTs and local governments and team members.
  • High commitment to ethical conduct, transparency, and accountability.
  • Valid driving license with the ability to travel frequently using a personal two-wheeler.
  • Key Responsibilities, JDs & other post details are attached.

Interested candidates between 18 and 45 years of age are encouraged to apply with their current CV and application letter to the email address vacancy@rrpk.org.np, clearly mentioning the position applying in the subject line and addressing the Human Resource Department, Rastriya RojgarPrawardhan Kendra, or submit the hard copy to the Rastriya RojgarPrawardhan Kendra Office at Malangwa-10, Sarlahi, by 26th December 2025, by 5:00 PM.
